comment:
The <image> SVG element includes images inside SVG documents. It can display raster image files or other SVG files.
The only image formats SVG software must support are JPEG, PNG, and other SVG files. Animated GIF behavior is undefined.
SVG files displayed with <image> are treated as an image: external resources aren't loaded, :visited styles aren't applied, and they cannot be interactive. To include dynamic SVG elements, try <use> with an external URL. To include SVG files and run scripts inside them, try <object> inside of <foreignObject>.

attributes.name: width
attributes.comment: The width the image renders at. Unlike HTML's , this attribute is required.

attributes.name: height
attributes.comment: The height the image renders at. Unlike HTML's , this attribute is required.

attributes.name: x
attributes.comment: Positions the image horizontally from the origin.

attributes.name: y
attributes.comment: Positions the image vertically from the origin.

attributes.name: href
attributes.comment: Points at a URL for the image file.

attributes.name: xlink:href
attributes.comment: Points at a URL for the image file.

attributes.name: preserveAspectRatio
attributes.comment: how the svg fragment must be deformed if it is embedded in a container with a different aspect ratio. eg: (none| xMinYMin| xMidYMin| xMaxYMin| xMinYMid| xMidYMid| xMaxYMid| xMinYMax| xMidYMax| xMaxYMax) (meet|slice)

attributes.name: crossorigin
attributes.comment: the value of the credentials flag for CORS requests.
